comment.author: 38896199@N06
comment._content: Any idea where this was taken? I know this is a bit of work but it may be worth adding each picture to your map. It means people could check the NLI flickr page and see any photos taken in their area! I know its not possible to locate each picture but as you have seen there are people out there that will help, as RICH AM proved in this picture www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland/5997404467/in/photostream

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/int0lerant] I always add photos to the map, but only when sure of the location, and we have gotten so much help from contacts, it's unbelievable. As info comes in, this one'll find its way to the map too... SO FAR: 316 items on Commons stream: www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland/map/ and 135 items on our Mixed Content flickr stream: www.flickr.com/photos/yournlireland/map/
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: They're baking blahs!  There was nothing like fresh blahs for breakfast with melting butter and home-made strawberry jam, yum, yum!!

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: This is more then likely John Adair's City Bakery at 18 Lady Lane, Waterford. He's listed in P.M. Egan's 1894 directory. I think the bakery occupied the site of the Library on the corner of Lady Lane & Bakehouse Lane. The foundation stone of the library was laid in 1903.

comment.author: 33577523@N08
comment._content: Just found my copy of the Waterford Standard, June 4 1898, this is an advertisement for the sale of items from John Adair's City Bakery in Lady Lane

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/33577523@N08] Thanks so much for not giving up on this one. Now we have another "Location Identified"! I've uploaded a higher res version, so we can all see more detail...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons
